lead_paragraph: In his annual letter to shareholders, the billionaire investor dismissed the view, popular on the campaign trail, that children in America would not live as well as their parents.

headline.print_headline: Buffett, in Annual Letter, Rejects Candidates’ Message of U.S. Decline
headline.main: Warren Buffett, in Annual Letter, Rejects Candidates’ Message of U.S. Decline

snippet: In his annual letter to shareholders, the billionaire investor dismissed the view, popular on the campaign trail, that children in America would not live as well as their parents.
abstract: Billionaire investor Warren E Buffett dismisses economic negativity perpetuated by 2016 presidential candidates in annual letter to shareholders; 30-page letter does warn of intensifying competition, and suggests providing safety net for those who want to work but find their skills out of favor because of market forces; Berkshire Hathaway reports 2015 earnings of $24.08 billion, up from $19.87 billion in 2014.
